Class Ship

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.battleship.Ship
All Implemented Interfaces:
IShip
Direct Known Subclasses:
Barge, Caravel, Carrack, Frigate, Galleon
public abstract class Ship extends Object implements IShip
Abstract base class representing a generic Ship. Implements common behavior for all ship types, such as position tracking, collision detection, and damage handling.

    • Ship

      public Ship(String category, Compass bearing, IPosition pos)
      Constructs a generic Ship.
      Parameters:
      category - The name/category of the ship.
      bearing - The orientation.
      pos - The reference start position.

  • Method Details

    • buildShip

      static Ship buildShip(String shipKind, Compass bearing, Position pos)
      Factory method to build specific Ship instances based on the category string.
      Parameters:
      shipKind - The type of ship ("barca", "nau", etc.).
      bearing - The orientation of the ship.
      pos - The starting position.
      Returns:
      A concrete Ship object (Barge, Frigate, etc.) or null if type is unknown.

    • stillFloating

      public boolean stillFloating()
      Description copied from interface: IShip
      Checks if the ship is still floating (not fully sunk). A ship is floating if at least one of its positions has not been hit.
      Specified by:
      stillFloating in interface IShip
      Returns:
      true if floating, false if sunk.
